document_title: Peptic ulcer disease: Causes, symptoms and diagnosis
subsection_content:
Treatment of duodenal ulcers will depend on the patient's ulcer condition and stage of the disease. At the same time, the doctor will also review the patient's medical history to be able to recommend appropriate treatment methods. (5) Some currently used methods of treating peptic ulcer disease include:
Acid-blocking drugs: Doctors will use common acid-suppressing drugs, the group of proton pump inhibitors (PPIs) that have the ability to block strong acid. Note that with this method, patients often need to eat a meal 30 minutes after taking the medicine to activate the medicine to work effectively.; Treatment with antibiotics: People infected with HP bacteria will be treated with antibiotics. This method requires the patient to complete the full dose and take the medicine at the right time to achieve the best results during the treatment process.; Treatment with intervention through upper digestive endoscopy: The doctor will use an endoscope to intervene on ulcers that are or are at high risk of bleeding.
